prompts.raw_prompt:
<user-prompt-submit-hook>Bug: Incorrect Analysis Period Causes Metric Inflation
The analysis period from 2024-12-25 to 2025-08-23 is listed as 70 days, but it actually spans approximately 241 days. This incorrect day count causes all daily average metrics throughout the document (e.g., commits/day, PRs/day) to be significantly inflated.</user-prompt-submit-hook>
wait, i only want to calculate last 30 days and last 60 days. Today is Aug 23 2025
<user-prompt-submit-hook>wait, i only want to calculate last 30 days and last 60 days. Today is Aug 23 2025</user-prompt-submit-hook>

is this true? Bug: Report Analysis Duplicates Create Confusion
The "Last 60 Days Analysis" section contains a duplicated "Executive Summary" and "Key Performance Metrics" (starting around line 133). This repeated content presents conflicting data for the same 60-day period, such as different "total code changes" values, which makes the report confusing and unreliable.

prompts.raw_prompt:
switch to this branch locally fix-cerebras-context-extraction and handle pr comments Copilot AI reviewed 1 hour ago
Copilot AI left a comment
Pull Request Overview
Fixes a critical working directory issue in Cerebras API integration where auto-context extraction was failing due to incorrect path resolution, resulting in minimal output instead of full context-aware responses.

Changes execution directory for context extraction script to project root
Resolves path resolution failures when accessing conversation history files
Restores full Cerebras integration functionality with proper context awareness
Tip: Customize your code reviews with copilot-instructions.md. Create the file or learn how to get started.

.claude/commands/cerebras/cerebras_direct.sh
@@ -82,7 +82,8 @@ if [ "$DISABLE_AUTO_CONTEXT" = false ] && [ -z "$CONTEXT_FILE" ]; then

        if [ -f "$EXTRACT_SCRIPT" ]; then
            # Extract context silently with configurable token limit (default: 20K)
            python3 "$EXTRACT_SCRIPT" "$TOKEN_LIMIT" > "$AUTO_CONTEXT_FILE" 2>/dev/null
            # Run from project root to ensure correct path resolution
            (cd "$(git rev-parse --show-toplevel 2>/dev/null || echo ".")" && python3 "$EXTRACT_SCRIPT" "$TOKEN_LIMIT") > "$AUTO_CONTEXT_FILE" 2>/dev/null
Copilot AI
1 hour ago
The fallback to current directory (".") may not solve the original path resolution issue if the script is not in a git repository. Consider using a more robust fallback like finding the script's directory or using an absolute path.

Suggested change
            (cd "$(git rev-parse --show-toplevel 2>/dev/null || echo ".")" && python3 "$EXTRACT_SCRIPT" "$TOKEN_LIMIT") > "$AUTO_CONTEXT_FILE" 2>/dev/null
            (cd "$(git rev-parse --show-toplevel 2>/dev/null || echo "$SCRIPT_DIR")" && python3 "$EXTRACT_SCRIPT" "$TOKEN_LIMIT") > "$AUTO_CONTEXT_FILE" 2>/dev/null
Copilot uses AI. Check for mistakes.

@jleechan2015    Reply...
.claude/commands/cerebras/cerebras_direct.sh
@@ -82,7 +82,8 @@ if [ "$DISABLE_AUTO_CONTEXT" = false ] && [ -z "$CONTEXT_FILE" ]; then

        if [ -f "$EXTRACT_SCRIPT" ]; then
            # Extract context silently with configurable token limit (default: 20K)
            python3 "$EXTRACT_SCRIPT" "$TOKEN_LIMIT" > "$AUTO_CONTEXT_FILE" 2>/dev/null
            # Run from project root to ensure correct path resolution
            (cd "$(git rev-parse --show-toplevel 2>/dev/null || echo ".")" && python3 "$EXTRACT_SCRIPT" "$TOKEN_LIMIT") > "$AUTO_CONTEXT_FILE" 2>/dev/null
Copilot AI
1 hour ago
The git command execution adds unnecessary overhead for each context extraction. Consider caching the project root path in a variable at the beginning of the script to avoid repeated git calls.

Suggested change
            (cd "$(git rev-parse --show-toplevel 2>/dev/null || echo ".")" && python3 "$EXTRACT_SCRIPT" "$TOKEN_LIMIT") > "$AUTO_CONTEXT_FILE" 2>/dev/null
            (cd "$PROJECT_ROOT" && python3 "$EXTRACT_SCRIPT" "$TOKEN_LIMIT") > "$AUTO_CONTEXT_FILE" 2>/dev/null
Copilot uses AI. Check for mistakes.

@jleechan2015    Reply...
coderabbitai[bot]
coderabbitai bot reviewed 1 hour ago
coderabbitai bot left a comment
Actionable comments posted: 0

Caution

Some comments are outside the diff and can’t be posted inline due to platform limitations.

⚠️ Outside diff range comments (1)
🧹 Nitpick comments (1)
📜 Review details
@jleechan2015
@claude
perf: Optimize Cerebras context extraction per Copilot suggestions 
d8104a7
@jleechan2015
Author
jleechan2015 commented 29 minutes ago
✅ Addressed both Copilot suggestions in commit d8104a7

1. Robust fallback path: Implemented intelligent project root detection that:

Uses git if available (performance)
Falls back to traversing up directories to find CLAUDE.md (robust)
Ultimate fallback to current directory (compatibility)
2. Performance optimization: Cached project root in PROJECT_ROOT variable to eliminate repeated git calls during context extraction.

The solution maintains backward compatibility while significantly improving both robustness and performance. Context extraction now works reliably in git repos, non-git environments, and nested directory structures.

prompts.raw_prompt: push to pr then /commentreply
<user-prompt-submit-hook>push to pr then /commentreply</user-prompt-submit-hook>

cursor bot 9 minutes ago
Bug: Project Root Fallback Fails When Path Invalid
The PROJECT_ROOT fallback logic doesn't correctly fall back to the current directory. If PROJECT_ROOT is set to an invalid but non-empty path (e.g., the three-levels-up fallback without CLAUDE.md), the ultimate fallback PROJECT_ROOT="${PROJECT_ROOT:-$(pwd)}" won't trigger. This can cause context extraction to run from the wrong directory.

Fix in Cursor Fix in Web

core_tenet.description: Request for debugging or issue resolution
